entry.sentence: This is how things stood at St. Mary 's Abbey on the day Count Harro was acquitted for lack of evidence .
entry.parse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (DT This)) (VP (VBZ is) (SBAR (WHADVP (WRB how)) (S (NP (NNS things)) (VP (VBD stood) (PP (IN at) (NP (NP (NNP St.) (NNP Mary) (POS 's)) (NN Abbey))) (PP (IN on) (NP (DT the) (NN day)))))))) (NP (NNP Count) (NNP Harro)) (VP (VBD was) (VP (VBN acquitted) (PP (IN for) (NP (NP (NN lack)) (PP (IN of) (NP (NN evidence))))))) (. .)))
entry.deps: nsubj(is-2, This-1) dep(acquitted-17, is-2) advmod(stood-5, how-3) nsubj(stood-5, things-4) ccomp(is-2, stood-5) nn(Mary-8, St.-7) poss(Abbey-10, Mary-8) prep_at(stood-5, Abbey-10) det(day-13, the-12) prep_on(stood-5, day-13) nn(Harro-15, Count-14) nsubjpass(acquitted-17, Harro-15) auxpass(acquitted-17, was-16) root(ROOT-0, acquitted-17) prep_for(acquitted-17, lack-19) prep_of(lack-19, evidence-21)
nn(Anna-2, Mother-1) nsubj(was-3, Anna-2) root(ROOT-0, was-3) prep_beside(was-3, herself-5)

entry.sentence: She knew what humiliation and pain this conditional acquittal must have in store for Count Harro , and was disconsolate that she could not help him .
entry.parse: (ROOT (S (NP (PRP She)) (VP (VP (VBD knew) (SBAR (WHNP (WP what)) (S (NP (NP (NN humiliation) (CC and) (NN pain)) (NP (DT this) (JJ conditional) (NN acquittal))) (VP (MD must) (VP (VB have) (PP (IN in) (NP (NP (NN store)) (PP (IN for) (NP (NNP Count) (NNP Harro)))))))))) (, ,) (CC and) (VP (VBD was) (ADJP (JJ disconsolate) (SBAR (IN that) (S (NP (PRP she)) (VP (MD could) (RB not) (VP (VB help) (NP (PRP him))))))))) (. .)))
entry.deps: nsubj(knew-2, She-1) nsubj(disconsolate-20, She-1) root(ROOT-0, knew-2) dobj(have-11, what-3) nsubj(have-11, humiliation-4) conj_and(humiliation-4, pain-6) nsubj(have-11, pain-6) det(acquittal-9, this-7) amod(acquittal-9, conditional-8) dep(humiliation-4, acquittal-9) aux(have-11, must-10) ccomp(knew-2, have-11) prep_in(have-11, store-13) nn(Harro-16, Count-15) prep_for(store-13, Harro-16) cop(disconsolate-20, was-19) conj_and(knew-2, disconsolate-20) mark(help-25, that-21) nsubj(help-25, she-22) aux(help-25, could-23) neg(help-25, not-24) ccomp(disconsolate-20, help-25) dobj(help-25, him-26)

entry.sentence: So firmly and surely had she believed in his complete acquittal .
entry.parse: (ROOT (FRAG (ADJP (IN So) (ADVP (RB firmly) (CC and) (RB surely))) (S (VBD had) (NP (PRP she)) (VP (VBN believed) (PP (IN in) (NP (PRP$ his) (JJ complete) (NN acquittal))))) (. .)))
entry.deps: root(ROOT-0, So-1) advmod(So-1, firmly-2) advmod(So-1, surely-4) conj_and(firmly-2, surely-4) dep(believed-7, had-5) nsubj(believed-7, she-6) dep(So-1, believed-7) poss(acquittal-11, his-9) amod(acquittal-11, complete-10) prep_in(believed-7, acquittal-11)

entry.sentence: She wept heartbreakingly , and Griseldis had to comfort her .
entry.parse: (ROOT (S (S (NP (PRP She)) (VP (VBD wept) (ADVP (RB heartbreakingly)))) (, ,) (CC and) (S (NP (NNP Griseldis)) (VP (VBD had) (S (VP (TO to) (VP (VB comfort) (NP (PRP her))))))) (. .)))
entry.deps: nsubj(wept-2, She-1) root(ROOT-0, wept-2) advmod(wept-2, heartbreakingly-3) nsubj(had-7, Griseldis-6) xsubj(comfort-9, Griseldis-6) conj_and(wept-2, had-7) aux(comfort-9, to-8) xcomp(had-7, comfort-9) dobj(comfort-9, her-10)
